header.name: chaos/preprocessor/detection/is_unary.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro used to detect unary parenthetic expressions.

macro.abstract: The macro detects whether its argument begins with a unary parenthetic expression.
macro.para: If x or __VA_ARGS__ begins with a unary parenthetic expression, this macro expands to 1. Otherwise, it expands to 0.
The expression to be tested must begin with a unary parenthetic expression or a non-parenthetic expression. A parenthetic expression of any other arity is invalid input.

In C99, a nullary parenthetic expression is a unary parenthetic expression that contains an empty element. Therefore, this macro expands to 1 if __VA_ARGS__ begins with a nullary parenthetic expression.
